page.title: 01History of Corfe Mullen
page.content:
{Corfe Mullen}covers just over 3000 acres of land in Dorset.The area of the Parish is roughly triangular and stetches from the river Stour in the north to Upton Heath in the south.
The original village was found around the church on a flat,dry river bed in the north-west corner.The Knoll and the Sleight were both in existence by 1327.18th and 19th century farmhouses were found around the Sleight.
The Parish boundary with Poole on the east runs along largely with the Roman Road from Hamworthy in the Parish of Poole.
